macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Sensex Jumps Over 600 Points as Indian Markets Rally Sharply
items.summary: India's Sensex surged over 600 points on February 20, reclaiming ground after a prior drop, with investors gaining ₹3 lakh crore amid short covering in heavyweight stocks and improved valuations. The Nifty 50 reclaimed the 25,660 mark, boosting BSE market cap to ₹468 lakh crore.

items.title: Indian Markets Plunge on February 19 Amid US-Iran Tensions
items.summary: BSE Sensex fell 1,236 points and Nifty 50 dropped 365 points on February 19 due to geopolitical shocks from US-Iran tensions, triggering broad sell-offs in realty, banking, and aviation sectors. Only three Nifty stocks closed green amid negative market breadth.

items.title: FOMC Minutes Spark Hawkish Headlines on Potential Rate Hikes
items.summary: FOMC minutes from February 19 indicated some participants open to rate hikes if inflation persists above target, fueling monetary policy doubts alongside Iran risks. Equities and bonds cheapened, with analysts skeptical of imminent Fed hikes or cuts.

items.title: US Leading Economic Index Signals Weaker Growth Ahead
items.summary: The Conference Board's US LEI declined 0.4% in December 2025, with weak consumer expectations, ISM new orders, and labor data dragging it down despite some positive financial components. The index improved from earlier contractions but points to weaker activity.

items.title: Caterpillar, Honeywell, Chevron Lead Dow's 2026 Gains
items.summary: Dow leaders Caterpillar (+31.6% YTD), Honeywell (+23.6%), and Chevron (+21.8%) drove gains through February 19 on record earnings and production; Dow up 3.4% YTD while most Magnificent 7 stocks declined. Chevron hit record output post-Hess deal.

items.title: Gold Price Hits $4,992 per Ounce on February 19
items.summary: Gold rose to $4,992/oz on February 19, up 0.71% daily, 5.38% monthly, and 69.85% yearly amid market volatility. Other metals like silver ($78/oz) and platinum ($1,672/oz) also tracked higher.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Stacks Raises $23M Series A to Scale Agentic AI for Enterprise Finance
items.summary: Stacks, an agentic AI platform for finance teams, secured $23 million in Series A funding led by Lightspeed to expand automation of reconciliations, journal entries, and month-end closes. The company also launched AI Flux Analysis to automate variance reporting, reducing cycles from days to minutes.

items.title: Kontakt.io Unveils Next-Gen AI Agents for Hospital Operations at ViVE 2026
items.summary: Kontakt.io launched an AI suite including Patient Journey Analytics, Supply Chain Agent, and others at ViVE 2026, enabling hospitals to optimize throughput, reduce equipment search times by 89%, and boost utilization by 1.8X using EHR and RTLS data.

items.title: New AI Tool M-PACT Enables Non-Invasive Brain Tumor Diagnosis from CSF
items.summary: Researchers from Medical University of Vienna, St. Jude, and KiTZ developed M-PACT, an AI algorithm that classifies brain tumors using cell-free DNA from cerebrospinal fluid, allowing precise diagnosis and monitoring without invasive biopsies. The study was published in Nature Cancer.

items.title: Gates Foundation, Novo Nordisk, and Wellcome Launch AI Health Impact Funding Call
items.summary: A new global partnership by the Gates Foundation, Novo Nordisk Foundation, and Wellcome opened a call for proposals to fund locally led evaluations of AI tools aimed at improving global health outcomes.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: PlayStation Shuts Down Bluepoint Games Studio
items.summary: PlayStation has closed Bluepoint Games, the studio behind Demon’s Souls and Shadow of the Colossus remakes, affecting around 70 employees following a business review. The decision comes amid industry restructuring, with a prior God of War live-service project cancelled.

items.title: Hasbro Shuts Down Internal Game Studio Atomic Arcade
items.summary: Hasbro has shuttered its internal video game studio Atomic Arcade as part of ongoing industry changes.

items.title: MADE IN JAPAN 2026 Collection Launches on Steam
items.summary: The Japan External Trade Organization (JETRO) has launched the MADE IN JAPAN COLLECTION 2026 on Steam, featuring Japanese games.

items.title: St8 Launches Casino Games in Ontario via Tonybet Partnership
items.summary: Casino games aggregator St8 has officially launched in Ontario's regulated market through a partnership with Tonybet.

items.title: ByteDance in Talks to Sell Gaming Unit Moonton for Over $6 Billion
items.summary: ByteDance is reportedly negotiating to sell its gaming unit Moonton for more than $6 billion, according to sources.

items.title: Tencent Secretly Funded Struggling Shooter Highguard
items.summary: Sources reveal that Tencent has been secretly funding the struggling shooter game Highguard.

items.title: Unity: AI Tech to Soon Prompt Full Casual Games into Existence
items.summary: Unity's boss states that developers will soon use generative AI to prompt full casual games into existence.

items.title: Mewgenics Sells 1 Million Copies in One Week
items.summary: The game Mewgenics has achieved 1 million sales within its first week of release.

items.title: Valve Warns of Steam Deck OLED Stock Issues Due to RAM Shortage
items.summary: Valve has issued a warning about potential stock shortages for Steam Deck OLED models caused by a RAM shortage.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Quantum eMotion Shares Approved for Trading on NYSE American
items.summary: Quantum eMotion Corp. has received approval to list its common shares on the NYSE American under ticker QNC, with trading expected to begin around February 24, 2026, to expand its U.S. shareholder base.

items.title: BTIG Names Top Tech Stocks for 2026 Including Twilio and Klaviyo
items.summary: BTIG highlighted Twilio as its large-cap top pick for 1H26 with a $165 price target after strong Q4 results, and Klaviyo as SMID-cap top pick with $40 target following 30% revenue growth.
